intro: Toxicoscordion venenosum, commonly known as the death cup, is a member of the Amanitaceae family and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a small, fleshy, cup-shaped fungus that grows in grassy areas, often in association with certain trees. The fruiting body is typically pale yellow to orange in color and has a distinctive, sticky cap. It is highly toxic due to the presence of amatoxins, which can cause severe liver damage and even death in humans and animals.
